lead_paragraph: The Tour of California, a 650-mile, eight-day race that is expected to attract some of cycling’s top international teams next month, announced Tuesday that it would increase testing of riders before and after each day’s event, and contribute its results to an antidoping database sponsored by the sport’s governing body.
